intro: Dacrydium gibbsiae, commonly known as the Cook Islands pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the Cook Islands. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, straight trunk and dense, needle-like foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and winged seeds, typical of conifers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found growing in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is also cultivated in other regions for horticultural purposes.
